page.title: 01EXWICK AND ST.DAVID'S
page.content: There are three main areas in this block: the central feature is the village of Exwick; to the north and west lie rough farm lands, and to the east part of the city of Exeter. { Exwick}is a fast-growing suburb of Exeter, having grown by 10 times since World War II. Most of its inhabitants work in the city, but a bakery and the railway remain its largest employers locally. The steep{valleys}to the north and west are farmed fairly intensively, although the housing estates are spreading year by year. The{St.David's}area of the city contains Exeter University, the Sixth Form College, the railway station, the city prison, one major and many minor hotels, and housing, both of the older terrace kind as well as modern detached houses.
